required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vestibular Socket Therapy With and Without Bone Grafting
clinical_study.official_title: Immediate Implant Placement Using Vestibular Socket Therapy With and Without Bone Grafting (Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial)

brief_summary.textblock: Management of the jumping gap in the Vestibular Socket Therapy. And to study what is the best technique to manage this gap for optimal esthetic result.

detailed_description.textblock:
22 patients were randomly assigned to Group 1: Had received implants with the vestibular socket technique accompanied with bone grafting the jumping gap between the implant and the labial membrane.
Group 2: Had received implants with the vestibular socket technique, but without bone grafting the jumping gap.
Facial bone thickness and height were evaluated using CBCT scans at baseline before tooth extraction and after 6 and 13 months

arm_group.arm_group_label: vestibular socket technique with bone grafting
vestibular socket technique without bone grafting

intervention.intervention_name: vestibular socket technique with bone grafting
intervention.description: a vestibular horizontal incision was made then a subperiosteal tunnel was created and a facial bone membrane was placed. The facial gap was filled with a mixture of autogenous bone and deproteinized bovine bone mineral
intervention.arm_group_label: vestibular socket technique with bone grafting

intervention.intervention_name: vestibular socket technique without bone grafting
intervention.description: the vestibular incision was done horizontally about 3 to 4 mm apical to the mucogingival junction and extending 5 to 10 mm horizontally. A submucoperiosteal tunnel was created labially from the socket orifice till the vestibular access incision
intervention.arm_group_label: vestibular socket technique without bone grafting

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- presence of a hopeless tooth or teeth in the esthetic zone (maxillary anterior area)
- No active infection
- Adequate bone palatally and apically
- Presence of contralateral tooth for the tooth being replaced
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hopeless tooth with acute infection
- heavy smokers (more than 10 cigarettes per day)
- pregnant and patients received recent chemotherapy/radiotherapy (during the previous year)

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant lecturer of DPH and Clinical statistician
